title: How to Summon a Waiter Politely

steps.title: Raise your hand, but don't wave.
steps.content: Raise your hand, but don't wave. Most waiters are very busy but will get to you eventually. Be patient if the restaurant is packed. The waiter might have many tables to help besides yours.

steps.title: Talk to your waiter with respect.
steps.content: Talk to your waiter with respect. Control your tone and attitude, a bossy or condescending way of speaking is not needed. Never yell or snap your fingers to get attention.

steps.title: Make eye contact with the waiter.
steps.content: Make eye contact with the waiter.

steps.title: Try to always remain polite.
steps.content: Try to always remain polite. If your waiter is ignoring you, be patient, he or she may be busy and stressed out with too much work.

steps.title: Remember that if the food does not taste good that the waiter is not responsible; if the food is cool, then it would be uncommon that the waiting staff is at fault, but it could happen.
steps.content: Remember that if the food does not taste good that the waiter is not responsible; if the food is cool, then it would be uncommon that the waiting staff is at fault, but it could happen.

steps.title: Avoid behaviors that will make your waiter want to pull out his or her hair and give you slow service.
steps.content: Avoid behaviors that will make your waiter want to pull out his or her hair and give you slow service. Changing your mind over dishes after they have been ordered Telling your waiter it is time to order than make them stand there for 10 minutes because you really have not decided what you want. Drinking too much alcohol Harassing other wait staff/customers Asking them out on a date Talking about your waiter even if they are standing right there. Ask for separate checks after the waiter bring you the bill or order dessert after the waiter brings the bill Asking the waiter to come back over and over again to take your order.

steps.title: Grabbing any waiter by the elbow to get service is a big no no.
steps.content: Grabbing any waiter by the elbow to get service is a big no no. Don't ever touch your waiter!

steps.title: Practice good manners when the waiter does arrive at your table and you are with a large party, do not ignore them.
steps.content: Practice good manners when the waiter does arrive at your table and you are with a large party, do not ignore them. It is very rude.
